page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Cheshire is a flat, dairy farming county which, millions of years ago, was covered by sea and hence sits on vast deposits of salt, 500 feet below ground. The accessibility of this salt led to the founding of Brunner Mond, a chemical firm which became I.C.I., still the major employer in the area. However, our D block is predominantly dairy farmland with two interesting saltworks and some minor industry. We have a Country Park called Marbury which has a Mere - a local name for a lake. Nearby, there is the picturesque village of Great Budworth. In Marston and Lower Wincham there are two salt works, one completely traditional and one modern. B.P. Nutrition, is situated in Lower Wincham. Comberbach and Wincham, once sleepy villages, have been extensively developed as residential areas in recent years.
